name: p-dinitrobenzene
source: Aldrich Chemical Company; Aldrich Catalog-Handbook of Fine Chemicals; Milwaukee; WI; 1984.
Reason: 1,2,3-Trinitro compounds have a melting point influenced by the functional groups relative to benzene's melting point of 5.5 °C. The basic unit for comparison is benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5 °C. The presence of three nitro groups significantly increases the melting point due to the ability to enhance π-π interactions and overall molecular rigidity. Each nitro group may contribute around +50 to +70°C.
